content: this legal case involves two parties referred to as xx and yy the case has been ongoing for 3 years and 1 month the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the specific amount was not mentioned the court made a final decision referred to as court dec the harju county court annulled a previous decision regarding the value of a škoda octavia car changing the value from 2983 euros to 2982 euros the court also decided to sell an apartment property in tallinn a public auction was held to divide the proceeds between xx and yy the court awarded sole ownership of the apartment in tallinn worth 75000 euros to yy and ordered xx to pay compensation of 24009 euros to yy for the majority common property xx must make this payment within 90 days xxs appeal was partially granted while yys appeal was dismissed the joint ownership of real estates in tallinn and haapsalu as well as the škoda octavia car was terminated the properties were divided equally between xx and yy xx was awarded sole ownership of the car while yy was awarded sole ownership of the apartment in tallinn yy was also entitled to compensation of 24009 euros from xx for the majority common property xx must make a payment of 12000 euros within 90 days and the remaining 12009 euros by december 31 2021 the court determined that the tallinn apartment was joint property and ordered the change of ownership entry in the register the costs of the proceedings will be borne by both parties the supreme court can be appealed within 30 days the case involves a dispute over joint property including apartments and a car between xx and yy the court divided the property and awarded compensation based on the value of their shares the defendant was ordered to pay the plaintiff a surplus of 24009 euros the defendant appealed but the court rejected their claim the court determined that the apartment in tallinn is joint property and ordered the defendant to compensate the plaintiff the defendant must make the payment within a specified time frame the supreme court explained the ruling with reference to relevant code articles the plaintiff is required to give consent for the change in ownership entry in the land register the court also determined that the procedural costs should be divided between the parties based on their financial situation
